alert.note: Alert for Lackawanna (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 11:13PM EDT until April 08 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Pennsylvania, including the following county, Lackawanna. * WHEN...Until 145 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1110 PM EDT, the guage at Parker Street on the Lackawanna River as of 1045 PM was 8.05 feet, just exceeding Moderate Stage of 8.0 feet. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Scranton, Dunmore, Archbald, Dickson City, Olyphant, Blakely, Taylor, Throop, Peckville and West Scranton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
